timeoutHint: A timeout setting that is too short may result in the inability to properly query link data.
collectorGatewayAddrHint: The externally exposed address of the APO server.
typeNotSupport: This feature is not available yet. Please stay tuned for updates!

apoCollector.port1: Used to receive link trace sampling data
apoCollector.port2: Used to receive and process log data
apoCollector.port3: Used to receive observability data, OTLP gRPC protocol
apoCollector.port4: Used to receive K85 cluster data, OTLP gRPC protocol
apoCollector.port5: Used to provide query API services

sidecar: Suitable for scenarios where the Tracing probe is already in use, and there is no intention to modify the Traces data sending address. APO will query data through the Trace system API.
collector: Suitable for scenarios where the Tracing probe is already in use, and it is possible to modify the Traces data sending address. APO will receive and store Traces data.
installAgentIntro1: Install the Syncause Data Agent in your business environment to collect real-time eBPF monitoring data from your business services.
installAgentIntro2: Configure it on this page to get the automatically generated one-click deployment command.
confirmDelete: Are you sure to delete the cluster integration {{name}}
sidecarGlobal: The same link tracking system shares the same configuration. Any modifications to this configuration take effect globally.
balckList: The specified items will be excluded from all namespaces.
metricsHint: Currently, only APO Self-Collect is supported. APO collects metrics with relatively low resource usage and data volume. Support for integrating other data sources is coming soon, so stay tuned
logHint: Currently, only APO Self-Collect is supported. APO collects logs with relatively low resource usage and data volume. Support for integrating other data sources is coming soon, so stay tuned
sampleHint: Only collect logs for slow requests and error requests at relevant time points, significantly reducing the volume of logs.

collectorDoc.selfConfig: Collector Integration Mode for Existing Metric Data
collectorDoc.installationMethod: Install APO OneAgent in trace-collector mode and then send the existing probe data to
collectorDoc.agentInstallation: APO requires an Agent installed on each host to obtain process information.
collectorDoc.probeAddressModification: Modify the probe data sending address to the local APO OneAgent address.
collectorDoc.advantages: Advantages: Supports Java, Go, Python, and other programming languages. Can utilize all APO features.
collectorDoc.disadvantages: Disadvantages: Requires adjustment of the tracing probe data sending address.
collectorDoc.otlpSupport: For Traces data that supports OTLP format:
collectorDoc.grpcUsage: If you use the gRPC protocol to send data, please use http://<local_IP>:4317
collectorDoc.httpUsage: If you use the HTTP protocol to send data, please use http://<local_IP>:4318
collectorDoc.skyWalkingGrpc: If you use the gRPC protocol to send data, please use http://<local_IP>:11800
collectorDoc.skyWalkingHttp: If you use the HTTP protocol to send data, please use http://<local_IP>:12800

installCmd.prereqDesc: Ensure your environment meets the following conditions:
installCmd.downloadWays: You can choose one of the following ways to obtain the configuration file:
installCmd.executeCmd: Copy and execute the command in the directory where the downloaded file is located.
installCmd.paramCreateNamespace: Creates the `apo` namespace if it does not exist.
installCmd.paramF: Uses the downloaded configuration file for installation.
installCmd.verifyCmd: After installation, you can check if the pods are running using the following command:
installCmd.successMsg: If all pods are in Running status, the installation was successful üéâ.If an issue occurs, please refer to the 'FAQ' section in the documentation.
installCmd.dockerDesc: On the server that needs monitoring, you can use Docker Compose to install and manage the OneAgent service. Follow these steps to proceed:
installCmd.chooseDownload: You can choose one of the following ways to obtain the configuration file:
installCmd.downloadPackage: Download the deployment package suitable for your environment.
installCmd.runInDir: Execute the following command in the directory where the configuration file and deployment package are located.
installCmd.verifyDocker: After installation, you can check if the Docker container is running using:
installCmd.successMsgDocker: If you see apo-related containers running, the installation was successful üéâ.If an issue occurs, please refer to the 'FAQ' section in the documentation.
installCmd.k8sDeployDesc: Execute commands to deploy agents in Kubernetes using Helm with one click
installCmd.dockerDeployDesc: Deploy agents with a single script in Kubernetes (via Helm) or Docker Compose environments.

eeToast: Upgrading to the Enterprise Edition will enable you to select this type of access.
